data.title: Whats not to like about the Helix Brewing Company
data.text: We decided to stop by for the live music on a recent Friday and were glad we did.  We love the layout and ambiance.  Excellent customer service and most importantly great brew.

data.title: Great brewery
data.text: This is a great little local brewery, they have done a great job of integrating a bar into the brewery and patio, dog friendly and great beers...

data.title: Great beer and atmosphere!
data.text:
This is such a fun place to grab a beer, or two. Their brews hit the spot, and they have one of my favorites- the Imperial Red Ale. 
Love that they have a variety of food trucks on the schedule, games to keep you entertained, and bands to add to the night.

data.title: Good beer, good place
data.text: This is a local brewery for me, it is a very comfortable place to hang and have beers and fill growlers. Good selection of beers, especially IPAs. I recommend the Rye IPA especially.

data.title: Nice friendly and cozy
data.text: We had a wonderful time at this place. It's cozy and the beer is good!  If you don't know what to order the staff will help you figure it out. The cost of the beer is reasonable too.We spent about 30.00 for 3 people with two servings.

data.title: Great Outdoor and indoor area
data.text: First off--the beer is excellent with a nice variety.  The facility is good for kids to wiggle around in while the parents enjoy a beverage.  We have been with just adults and the food trucks for an evening meal.  We will be back.  The owener is available and hands on.

data.title: Great company
data.text: We went on opening night and met friends. People were polite and a great atmosphere. Kinda small inside though.

data.title: Great beer in the garden
data.text: This place was amazing. By the street view you would never guess that a beautiful patio garden area was in the back with ample seating and a very welcoming environment. Their beer is freaking awesome and inexpensive. They offer a good variety of beers and different sizes so you can sample, Go for a pint, or take a growler home. Will definitely be back!

data.title: Drink Craft Beer Under a Tule Tree
data.text: Helix Brewing Co. is the latest addition to La Mesa's craft brew scene. Opened in early September in a former distributorship building, the charming, renovated brick venue offers inside and outside seating and about a dozen choices of brews -- we enjoy the flights for a chance to taste around. Red N' Active and Helix Pale Ale were favored on this initial trip. The brew area and bar are housed in the well-designed, airy one-story building; the patio seating is arrayed around a big tree the partner-owners --Karen, Casey and Cameron (easy to remember) -- had hauled in to successfully soften the sense that this is in an industrial area off Interstate 8. You would never know it; the beer-tasting room and patio are designed to enfold and make visitors at home and comfortable. Food trucks and entertainment offer more reasons to linger and invite friends and family to join you under the tule tree.
